name: Mr.Zhu Leng
description: Transform coronation chicken by adding mango chutney, creamy tahini and nigella seeds. Use it in this colourful layered salad or as a sandwich filling

name: Mr.Fu Difeng
description: Our best ever spaghetti bolognese is super easy and a true Italian classic with a meaty, chilli sauce. This recipe comes courtesy of BBC Good Food user Andrew Balmer
Ingredient: 1: medium onions, 2:celery sticks, 3: beef mince, 4:dried oregano
method: 1:Put a large saucepan on a medium heat and add 1 tbsp olive oil.
2:Add 4 finely chopped bacon rashers and fry for 10 mins until golden and crisp.
3:Increase the heat to medium-high, add 500g beef mince

name: Mr.Zhang Ming
description: Flavoured with honey, hoisin sauce and Chinese five-spice, this one-pan chicken dish makes a cheap and easy midweek family meal
method: 1:Pour over the chicken and toss to coat.
2:Roast, skin-side up, for 35 mins, basting at least once.
3:Stir through the cashew nuts and sprinkle the spring onions over the chicken.

name: Mr.Han Suer
description: Chinese style chicken wings with a delicious twist, made using just 5 ingredients. They make a tasty lunch or make a batch to share with friends
Ingredient: 1:large chicken wings, 2:reduced salt soy sauce, 3: brown sugar, 4:vinegar,
method: 1: In a roasting tray, toss the wings with the soy sauce.
2:Roast, skin-side up, for 35 mins, basting at least once.
3:Roast for 40 mins, turning occasionally until lacquered.

name: Mr.Jana Tong
description: Don't reach for the takeaway menu, try this beef stir-fry recipe instead. It's just as tasty as your favourite Chinese and healthier too.
Ingredient: 1:lean beef, 2:red pepper, 3: spring onions, 4:dark soy sauce
method: 1: Put the meat in the freezer 25-30 mins with the soy sauce.
2:Meanwhile, remove the core and seeds from the pepper and cut it.

name: Mrs.Arban Zhong
description: Make this beef stew when the nights draw in. With aubergine and Chinese spices, the flavours are warming and it's slow-cooked for deliciously tender meat Nutrition: Per serving.
method: 1:Heat a large casserole dish, toast the anise and cinnamon until fragrant.
2:Add the spices and meat back in, skim off any fat that comes to the surface.
3:Scatter over the coriander and sliced red chilli, then serve with rice.
